report: The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. (ELC) is a multinational manufacturer and marketer of prestige skincare, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products. The company was founded in 1946 by Estée Lauder and her husband Joseph Lauder. Today, it operates as a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol EL. The company's headquarters are located at 767 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10153, USA. This iconic address is in the General Motors Building in Midtown Manhattan. The Estée Lauder Companies owns a diverse portfolio of brands, including its flagship brand Estée Lauder, as well as Clinique, MAC, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, and many others. As of the latest available data, the company employs approximately 62,000 people worldwide, according to its 2023 Annual Report. The company operates manufacturing facilities in multiple countries, including the United States, Belgium, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and Canada. Its largest production site is located in Blaine, Minnesota, USA. Other significant manufacturing locations include Oevel, Belgium (for European production), and Markham, Ontario, Canada. The Estée Lauder Companies has a significant global footprint, with products sold in over 150 countries and territories. The company operates through both direct retail (including standalone stores and e-commerce) and through third-party distributors, department stores, and specialty retailers. As a publicly traded company, Estée Lauder's shareholders include institutional investors and individual shareholders. The largest shareholders are typically institutional investment firms. According to the company's 2023 proxy statement, the top institutional shareholders include The Vanguard Group, BlackRock, and State Street Corporation. The Lauder family maintains a significant ownership stake and control through their ownership of Class B shares, which carry enhanced voting rights. William P. Lauder, the grandson of the founders, serves as Executive Chairman, and Fabrizio Freda has been President and CEO since 2009. The company's financial performance has shown consistent growth over the years, with reported net sales of $17.74 billion in fiscal year 2023. The Asia-Pacific region has become the company's largest market, surpassing the Americas in recent years. For verification of this information, primary sources include the company's official website (www.elcompanies.com), annual reports (2023 Annual Report available on the investor relations section of the website), and SEC filings (particularly the 10-K annual report). Independent sources include Bloomberg's company profile for EL, Reuters' stock analysis pages, and industry reports from market research firms like Euromonitor International. The company's manufacturing locations are confirmed through various press releases about facility expansions and local business reporting in the respective regions where plants are located.
